title: JB Hi-Fi Logo (Australian/NZ Electronics store chain)
content:
Hi there,

Was wondering if any of you kind people could tell me if the JB Hi-Fi logo is a particular typeface or custom-made. Thanks in advance! :D

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222215550im_/http:/typophile.com/files/JB-HIFI_5448.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222215550im_/http:/typophile.com/files/jbhifi_6190.jpg)
author: klokwerk

comments.content:
With all the squared techno fonts out there you'd think this should be easy to match, but the closest resemblance I found, even searching freeware sites, was [ITC Bolt](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222215550/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-bolt/), which has squared counters and the wrong stroke width, or [Jay Gothic Extra Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20111222215550/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/jay-gothic/), which would need to be flattened/widened and otherwise massaged.

This leads me to think that it is possibly a custom lettering job.

- Mike Yanega

Thanks. I do think it's a custom job, but ITC Bolt will be a good substitute for what I'm doing. Thank you.

If anyone thinks they can identify it as an actual typeface, by all means post here though. :)
